news.title: YEIDA set to select agency to design Hathras hub plan under master plan 2031
news.para: Yamuna Expressway Industrial Development Authority will appoint a consultant. The consultant will prepare a detailed project report for Hathras Urban Centre. This centre is the fourth urban centre under Phase-II Master Plan 2031. The DPR will guide land acquisition and project execution. It will also help in the organised growth of Hathras.

news.title: Manimajra housing project to feature rare basement parking
news.para: Chandigarh's Manimajra is set for a new housing scheme. It will cost over Rs 780 crore. The project includes basement parking in each of the five plot clusters. 80% of the basement will be for parking. The rest will house utilities. Separate collector rates are planned for residential and commercial properties. The project awaits environmental clearance before starting.

news.title: Manesar civic body to charge property owners for cleaning vacant plots
news.para: The Municipal Corporation of Manesar (MCM) will now charge property owners for cleaning costs if garbage accumulates on their vacant plots or private premises. This initiative aims to improve sanitation and public health in the area. Door-to-door waste collection will resume in Manesar after a two-year gap, with a five-year contract awarded to a firm for Rs 64.9 crore.

news.title: Grihum Housing Finance set to name ex-Citi banker MD, CEO
news.para: In a notice to stock exchanges on August 21, Grihum Housing Finance had announced that its current MD & CEO Manish Jaiswal will step down with effect from August 31. Jaiswal will continue as an advisor to the board until December 31. The company had said it would identify a suitable candidate for the top post in due course.

news.title: Property owners slam Bengaluru development body for steep khata charges
news.para: Property owners said they are not opposed to paying a fee for transferring khata but have objected to the steep hike introduced by the BDA. They argue that the increased amount is not only arbitrary but also places an unnecessary financial burden on those seeking to update property ownership records without any significant additional service or benefit.

news.title: Farmhouses back in Aravalis hills; NGT seeks reports from Haryana & Rajasthan in four weeks
news.para: National Green Tribunal addresses illegal construction in Aravali hills. Haryana Pollution Control Board and Sohna Municipal Council must submit compliance reports. The case involves reconstruction of farmhouses in Raisina, violating environmental laws. Tribunal allows Resident Welfare Association participation.

news.title: JK Cement board approves ₹4,805 crore investment to add seven MTPA capacity
news.para: JK Cement Ltd announced a significant expansion plan, investing Rs 4,805 crore in a new 7 million tonnes per annum cement line. The project includes a 4 MnTPA clinkerisation unit and a 3 MnTPA cement grinding unit in Jaisalmer, Rajasthan.

news.title: My Home Constructions appoints Abhishek Kapoor as new CEO
news.para: My Home Constructions, a Hyderabad-based company, has appointed Abhishek Kapoor as its new CEO. Kapoor, formerly with Puravankara, will lead the company's expansion efforts in Bengaluru, Chennai, and Mumbai, focusing on differentiated products and customer experience.

news.title: Regularise balconies, other extensions in Noida houses, residents say
news.para: FONRWA has appealed to the Noida Authority CEO to regularize unauthorized extensions like rear balcony covers in residential properties. They propose imposing penalties or fees for regularization, citing security concerns with open balconies and the need for more space due to rising housing costs.

news.title: Over 40 AOAs in Noida protest FIRs filed against them for internal disputes and accidents
news.para: Noida's apartment owners are protesting against recent FIRs filed against AOAs for incidents within residential complexes, citing lack of authority and unjust administrative actions. Over 40 AOAs gathered to condemn the legal actions following incidents like a plaster fall causing injury and sewage dumping. They demand transparent inquiries and autonomy, threatening agitation if dialogue fails.

news.title: UP-RERA holds weekly ‘RERA Samvaad’ to address homebuyers’ grievances
news.para: UP-RERA conducted its weekly 'RERA Samvaad', addressing homebuyers' concerns regarding possession delays and legal remedies. Chairman Sanjay Bhoosreddy emphasized the platform's role in boosting consumer confidence and promoting transparency. UP-RERA assured prioritized complaint resolution and strict action against defaulting promoters, continuing its outreach with weekly sessions.

news.title: ED arrests Galaxy Constructions' director from Mumbai hotel in bank loan fraud case
news.para: Amit Ashok Thepade, director of a Pune-based real estate firm, was arrested from a Mumbai hotel in connection with a Rs 117.06 crore bank loan fraud involving Canara Bank. The Enforcement Directorate (ED) seized Rs 9.5 lakh in cash and jewellery worth Rs 2.3 crore.

news.title: Court denies HDIL’s promoter permission to travel to Hyderabad, but can visit other places
news.para: A special court refused Sarang Wadhawan's request to visit Hyderabad due to a pending threat investigation. Wadhawan faces money laundering charges. The court permitted him to travel to Tamil Nadu, Goa, and Uttarakhand for religious reasons. He can also visit NCR for legal consultations.

news.title: China Evergrande Group delisted from Hong Kong stock exchange
news.para: Shares in heavily indebted China Evergrande Group were taken off the Hong Kong Stock Exchange on Monday, capping a grim reversal of fortune for the once-booming property developer. The statement added that China Evergrande Group was a holding company and that liquidators had assumed control of more than 100 companies within the group.

news.title: 360 ONE Asset acquires 50% stake in Bluegrass Business Park in Pune for ₹2,400 crore
news.para: 360 ONE Asset procured a 50% stake in Bluegrass Business Park. The acquisition was made from Brookfield Asset Management. The business park is a two million sq ft office development. It is located in Kalyani Nagar, Pune. The deal was valued at approximately ₹2,400 crore. Brookfield will continue to manage the asset. They will also oversee development and leasing.

news.title: HUDCO plans to raise up to ₹3,000 crore through debentures
news.para: HUDCO is set to raise up to Rs 3,000 crore through non-convertible debentures, approved by the Board of Directors as part of a larger Rs 65,000 crore bond issuance plan for 2025-26. The decision comes after the company reported a 13% increase in consolidated net profit for the first quarter and declared an interim dividend.

news.title: Krrish Realtech diverted ₹205-crore homebuyers' fund for Colombo hotel: ED
news.para: A Gurugram-based realty group, Krrish Realtech, defrauded home buyers. The group collected over Rs 500 crore for housing plots. However, they diverted Rs 205 crore to a Sri Lanka hotel project. The Enforcement Directorate (ED) is investigating Amit Katyal and others. Katyal is already arrested in another case. The ED filed a chargesheet and the court issued a notice.

news.title: Gaurs Group acquires 12-acre land at Yamuna Expressway
news.para: Gaurs Group has expanded its portfolio with the acquisition of a 12-acre land parcel along the Yamuna Expressway, earmarked for a new residential project. The company plans to invest ₹1,400 crore in developing high-rise, ultra-luxury residences, anticipating a topline of ₹2,000 crore.

news.title: India’s highest selling market - Pune sells 44,000 new homes in January-June 2025: Data expert Rahul Ajmera decodes the trends
news.para: Pune continues to outpace other metro cities with record sales of new homes, driven by affordable pricing and dual IT+Manufacturing economy

news.title: Illegal constructions razed in urban areas of Panchkula
news.para: In Panchkula, the District Town Planner (DTP) recently conducted a significant enforcement drive, demolishing 15 unauthorized DPC constructions in Barona Khud village. These actions were taken after serving prior notices to defaulters who failed to remove the illegal structures.
